meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be touched or grasped.
meanings.sent1: She described the ghost intangibly moving through the walls.
meanings.sent2: The concept of love is intangibly beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The idea of time travel intangibly tickled her imagination.
meanings.sent4: His dreams felt intangibly close yet out of reach.
meanings.sent5: The music evoked an intangibly nostalgic feeling in her heart.

meanings.definition: In a way that cannot be quantified or measured.
meanings.sent1: The value of friendship is intangibly precious.
meanings.sent2: Her influence on the team was intangibly positive.
meanings.sent3: The mystery of the missing sock intangibly amused him.
meanings.sent4: His impact on society was intangibly profound.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies was intangibly comforting.
